text: How to manage local vs production settings in Django?

A Django newbie question:
What is the recommended way of handling settings for local development and the production server?

Some of them (like Constants, etc) can be changed/accessed in both, but some of them (like paths to static files) need to remain different, and hence should not be overwritten everytime the new code is deployed...
Currently, I am adding all constants to settings.py.
But every time I change some constant locally, I have to copy it to the production server and edit the file for production specific changes... :(
